scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. Previously, when one of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time,' you responded by encouraging the team to stay focused and work together. During a team meeting, [Monica] slammed her pen on the table and added, 'Even if we try our best, there's no way we can meet this deadline.' [Bob] nodded in agreement, looking equally concerned. You then acknowledged their frustration but emphasized the importance of focusing on what can be controlled. [Monica] leaned forward, exasperated, and said, 'Focusing on what we can control is fine, but what about the lack of time?' [Bob] chimed in, 'Yeah, we're still going to need more hours in the day to get this done.' You emphasized adapting to the situation and putting in extra effort. Now, [Monica] stands up and paces around, frustration still evident, 'Even if we put in extra effort, we’re still stretched too thin.' [Bob] sighs, 'We need more people or we’re just setting ourselves up to fail.'
scenes.description: [Monica] continues pacing, and [Bob] looks at you, waiting for a definitive solution.

options.text: Let's see if we can redistribute some tasks or ask other departments for temporary support.
options.analysis: You suggested seeking external support and redistributing tasks, demonstrating good emotional perception and empathy.

options.text: I understand the concern, but we need to push through this. Let's focus on what we can achieve.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the team's concern and emphasized persistence, showing balanced emotional intelligence and high motivation.

options.text: We have to make do with what we have. Let's prioritize the tasks and work together to get through this.
options.analysis: You focused on prioritizing tasks and teamwork, showing good self-regulation and social skills.
